title: The Blind Seer
description: A surviving moderate priest tells you the zealots were planning to awaken a "Sleeping God" in the city's depths. You must consult the Blind Seer in the Deep Archive to understand this threat.

turns.narrative: The Deep Archive's automated guardians have been corrupted by the zealots' magic. They attack you in the stacks.
turns.choice_a: Use electricity to short them out
turns.consequence_a: They freeze instantly, but the sparks ignite several ancient, irreplaceable tomes.
turns.choice_b: Disable them gracefully using Thieves Tools
turns.consequence_b: You dismantle them core by core, preserving the historical knowledge.

turns.narrative: The Blind Seer is ancient, reading raised runes with withered fingers. She reveals the Concordat's true nature—they worship an ancient entity trapped beneath Emberheart.
turns.consequence_a: She gives you the coordinates but demands you swear an unavoidable geas to kill it. You accept the magical binding.
turns.choice_b: Threaten her to get the information without binding
turns.consequence_b: She gives you the coordinates but curses your weapons, causing them to deal 10% less damage for the next week.

geas_sworn.description: You swore to kill the Concordat's God, unlocking the path.

cursed_intel.description: You coerced the Seer, gaining the intel but suffering a curse.

conclusion: You swore to kill the Concordat's God, unlocking the path.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor lasting consequences. The thread remains open.
